metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3854 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in Ceph, relating to the URL processing on RGW backends. An attacker can exploit the URL processing by providing a null URL to crash the RGW, causing a denial of service.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in 16.1 This is fixed in jammy-updates and kinetic-updates, but is not yet in the -security pocket.

criterions.comment: ceph: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
